src:
Un jutge avala el tancament de la discoteca Pachá durant 15 dies ordenat per l'Ajuntament de Barcelona
El club havia recorregut l'expedient sancionador per incompliments en matèria de seguretat

05 Nov 2019, 12:43

El jutjat contenciós administratiu número 17 de Barcelona ha rebutjat el recurs presentat per la discoteca Pachá contra el tancament durant 15 dies ordenat per l'Ajuntament de Barcelona. La mesura, avançada per El Periódico, és fruit d'un expedient sancionador obert pel consistori contra tres discoteques del Front Marítim per incompliments en matèria de seguretat. Totes han recorregut i ara arriba la primera resposta judicial. El tancament va ser notificat dilluns a la discoteca i es farà efectiu al cap de 48 hores, és a dir, aquest dimecres.Segons el jutge, en aquest cas "preval l'interès públic per sobre del privat" i cal tenir en compte que "el compliment efectiu d'una sanció administrativa comporta un principi d'exemplaritat que s'ha de tenir en compte". "L'administració ha d'exigir amb el màxim de rigor un compliment exhaustiu de les mesures de seguretat", continua. El jutge considera que el tancament durant 15 dies genera un perjudici, però no suficient per acceptar les mesures cautelars que plantejava la discoteca. 




Ciutat Vella tancarà Pacha, Shoko i Carpe Diem

L'anterior regidora de Ciutat Vella, Gala Pin, va anunciar fa sis mesos l'obertura de tres expedients sancionadors a tres discoteques del Front Marítim: Pachá, Shoko i Carpe Diem. De fet, tal com va explicar l'ARA, el govern municipal pretén un canvi d'usos en aquest espai, que depèn de l'Estat. Pin va assegurar que les negociacions estaven molt avançades perquè aquests terrenys es convertissin en una gran zona d'equipaments, però el govern espanyol es va desmarcar d'aquestes declaracions. De fet, un mes després va renovar els permisos a les discoteques fins al juny del 2020.
text:
A judge confirms the closure of the Pachá nightclub for 15 days ordered by the Barcelona City Council
The club had resorted to the sanctions file for security breaches

05 Nov 2019, 12:43

The administrative litigious court number 17 of Barcelona has rejected the appeal filed by the Pachá club against the closure for 15 days ordered by the City Council of Barcelona. The measure, advanced by El Periódico, is the result of a sanctioning proceedings opened by the council against three discos of the Front Marítimo for security breaches. All have traveled and now comes the first judicial response. The closure was notified Monday to the club and will be effective after 48 hours, that is, on Wednesday. According to the judge, in this case "the public interest over private" prevails and it should be taken into account that "the effective enforcement of an administrative penalty entails a principle of exemplary that must be taken into account". "The administration must strictly enforce the security measures with the utmost rigor," he continues. The judge considers that the closing for 15 days generates a damage, but not enough to accept the precautionary measures raised by the disco.




Ciutat Vella will close Pacha, Shoko and Carpe Diem

The former town councilor of Ciutat Vella, Gala Pin, announced six months ago the opening of three sanctioning proceedings in three discos of the Front Marítimo: Pachá, Shoko and Carpe Diem. In fact, as the ARA explained, the municipal government intends to change its uses in this space, which depends on the State. Pin said that the negotiations were very advanced because these lands became a large area of equipment, but the Spanish government was detached from these statements. In fact, a month later he renewed permits at the clubs until June 2020.
